content.description: Sit start on the lowest shelf. Move through shelves to Zoidberg’s undercling tentacles out left.  Instead of bailing out left to the crack move straight up along the arete and top out. Top is a little dirty but doable. Cool features. Exit off to the right.
content.protection: A couple pads are nice. Sloped landing isn’t super great. Spotter for the tree is nice.
content.location: On exposed rock face before you reach the Fridge and Novocain.

content.description: Some might say this isn’t a boulder problem...  Nay I say to them!!  Unconventional but wicked fun. You must try this problem if you’re here. No reason not to. Get a running start and run up the big satellite dish shaped depression in the boulder.  Get as many steps in as you can before you slap some slopers and friction your way to the very top of the boulder. You’ll probably come sliding down the first couple trys. Looks easier than it is. Threw a v-easy grade on it but it could actually be harder...
content.location: The big dish shaped side of the boulder. You can hop off the lowest part of the boulder. There’s a boulder above the refrigerator boulder and Novocain. Hike up to the top and walk back several feet. Can’t miss it.

content.description: Start right side of "Warped Wall". Static problem working seams to the top-out of this slabby boulder.
content.location: Right side of "Warped Wall".

content.description: Sit start at the base of the "Shark Tooth", with both hands on the rail. Move up from there and top-out.
content.location: On the exposed rock face before you reach Zoidburg and Pupil. See images for picture of the route. Look for a "shark-tooth looking" protrusion at the base of the rock face.

content.description: Starts matching on small crimp rail. Smear some feet and get up to next crimp rail. Hand foot match. Stand up to flake/crack.
content.location: Left side of slabby section of boulder.

content.description: Climb the tongue shaped feature. Serves as a good down climb as well.
content.location: Left of Zoidburg/Solomon’s Seal.

content.description: Sit start on a nice pocket and whatever else feels good (there’s some options). Small ramp to left is off for feet. Head up the arete and top out to the right of the sapling.
content.location: Pass most all of the swamp routes. Pass the rest day boulder. Keep the stream to your left and you’ll see the obvious short cliff band. This is the first arete you see.

content.description: Sit start on the left side of the boulder with a great left hand jug and right hand pod in the crack. Head out right to a series of decent holds then head up left along the sloped arete until you can get into the gully.
content.location: On the Rest Day boulder past most of the other swamp routes. Obvious chalked start hold.

content.description: Start left hand in ledgey jug and right on crimp inside of the crack. Find your feet. Throw a tall right hand up and to the lip. Work your way through some jugs to top out.
content.location: Opposite side of the Lagoon routes. See Crack from the Black Lagoon for more info.

content.description: Start somewhere sitting on the right end of the crack and head straight up to a mantle finish.
content.location: On the warped wall boulder above the mini cliff faces.

content.description: Stand start at the big jug above your head. Move right to the peak of the boulder and top out.
This boulder can only be climbed in winter when the swamp freezes over. Climb the fist sized crack. Over before you know it. Okay only cause it looks cool.
content.location: Boulder itself sits in the swamp. You’ll see the exposed rock face and many of the routes from the other boulders and vice versa. Climb the obvious fist sized crack. Downclimb shorter crack on the opposite side to get down.

content.description: Same start as Zoidberg on the low shelf. Move up to second shelf and then right to the hole. Head straight up to the right of the big dish. Top out.
Same start as Solomon Seal Low but use the dish instead of the low fist jam.
Climb slab section of boulder to the left of the big crack. The crack/arête is off.  Using small crimps get to the top. Super quality rock and nice holds.
content.location: To the left of Crack from the Black Lagoon. See description of that route for direction on how to get to this boulder. Only climbale in winter when the swamp is frozen.

content.description: Climb the short crack to the right of the Tongue. If it were taller it would be more worthwhile.
Sit start on the good low jug. Work straight up the crack and top out.
content.location: To the right of Vernal Equinox. Look for the short splitter.

content.description: Sit start on a good hold and climb up and a bit left.
content.location: Way beyond most of the other rocks. A cluster of boulders sits behind some houses on route 13. The pond is not too much further. Discretion is good here as you are basically in someone’s back yard.

content.description: Start matched on the flake on the overhang. Move up with some nice holds to the lip. Move right to top out on good jugs. The flake is a bit chossy but seemed to be holding me pulling on it well. The rest of the route is on good holds.
content.protection: Couple pads to cover the rock on the landing.
content.location: To the left of Raby Soldier. See Raby Soldier for info on how to get to the welcome boulder.

content.description: Short and sweet! Start matched on the same jug as for "Swamp Gas" but instead of heading right, go straight up.
content.location: To the right of Anthropology. Starts on same start jug on Swamp Gas

content.description: Start sitting directly below the water runoff. Move straight up to a tough mantle move. Finish the scramble up the gully.
content.protection: Couple pads at least. Not a great landing at all but with some pad stacking and spotting you’ll be good.
content.location: This route is on a separate boulder past Novocain and the rest of the swamp boulders. Route goes straight up the nose.

content.description: Start low on right arete using jugs in the crack. Move up the arête using nice holds. Top out can either be on the face to the left or right through the big crack. Going left may be a bit harder. Good for warming up for the rest of the swamp routes.
content.location: This route is on what I call the welcome boulder. It’s the first boulder you’ll come across when heading to the swamp boulders. On the scabbard mill trail you’ll see a flat topped boulder on the left. Several more feet up the trail the welcome boulder lurks off to the right. Hard to see in summer due to foliage but sort of visable in fall. Overhanging on one side. Raby Soldier is on the right side arête of the overhang.

content.description: Start matched on the shelf. Move up through crimps trending left to a slopey top out. Commiting top makes it feel spicy.
content.protection: A few pads are nice. Spotter isn’t a bad idea as well. Even though the route itself isn’t super long a fall from the top could send you for a decent ride. Tiered landing.
content.location: On exposed rock face before you reach the Fridge and Novocain. To the right of the crack project Kill Your Master.

content.description: A rad and logical line. Start on the obvious sloper shelf, move directly up via crystals and a hard mantle move.
content.location: To the left of Anthropology. A link up starting on Anthro and finishing up Ornith has yet to be done, or the other way around.

content.description: Stand start at the big flake with great holds. Gaston the thin vertical crack to gain the slopey horizontal feature. Move a bit right onto some crimps and top out.
content.location: To the left of Pupil. Look for an obvious giant low flake and thin crack on a bulge.

content.description: Start matching on a good jug. Pull up from sit and work up on good holds to the scoop/dish like lip. Pull over the top. Way fun boulder problem that climbs super smooth.
content.protection: An couple pads. A spotter is probably a good idea because the landing is tiered.
content.location: Left of refrigerator shaped boulder. The start is up on the little ledge. Follow the holds just to the right of the arête. Walk off the back to get down.

content.description: Sit start the crimp rail. Find the good jug at the arete, hold the swing and finish up on Novocain.
content.location: Start to the left of Novocain.

content.description: Start matched on low jug with some good feet. Move up and left and follow arete to peak. You can exit early.
content.location: To the left of Joey Bag O’ Donuts. See that route for info on how to get to this boulder.

content.description: Start low matching on huge jug. Move up to big sloper rail. Follow the thin crack up and right using crimp(s). Sloper top out is the crux.
content.location: This route is located on a nice exposed rock face set back away from the other swamp boulders a bit. You’ll have to bush whack to get here. Worth the trek IMO. Look for a ravine/trench with some exposed rock that’s obscured in a hemlock stand.  There will be a small stream in the bottom of the trench in wet months. On the far right side of the exposed face is this route.

content.description: Start sitting using the super cool underclings. Head straight up over the lip using some crimps and slopers. Detached block is on as it still seems like part of the boulder.
content.location: Past most of the swamp boulders, on the same boulder as Rest Day and Tales From the Cryptic. Really just follow the swamp/stream with it on your left. Big boulder is pretty obvious.

content.description: Start on the same hold as Treehouse but instead of hitting the big flake/jug trend right up the slab to the very top ridge. Tall but very mellow.
content.location: Treehouse boulder. Same start as Treehouse but trend right up slab

content.description: Cool looking boulder that looks like a refrigerator except the top isn’t square... Start as low as you can on either arête and work your way to the top. I found myself bumping right a couple times before moving my left. There’s a nice jug that’s a little blind that helps you pull up and over.
content.location: Very obvious boulder to the right of Novocain.

content.description: Start standing. Left hand will be by one of the drill holes. Right hand catches friction on a sloper (sort of).  If you don’t start in a specific way this may seem way harder than it actually is. Find your way up to micro crimps that help you gain the jug. The starting hold for Tree House is off but the left arete is on. Go straight up. Crux moves are low, the rest is a scramble.
content.protection: Pad or two. There is a nasty sharp rock which is nice to protect.
content.location: Left of Tree House and Cowabunga. Look for three drilled holes where someone has feathered and wedged a chunk off of the corner of the boulder.

content.description: Would be much better, if it wasn't for the tree. It is still climbable and enjoyable, so I figured I would post it. Start at the far right side with hands in the crack and traverse the crack from right to left. Crux is getting around that tree without dabbing it. Top out after you get around the tree.
content.location: On the side of the boulder with "Warped Wall". See image.

content.description: Start at left end of crack system. Left hand on big jug and right hand in the crack. Work your way up the crack system and top out whenever you cannot continue up the crack any further.There is a problem that works the entire length of the crack, with hands only in the crack-system to the very end. It has been sent. Not sure on the grade.
content.location: On the back side of the boulder with the Warped Wall problem.

content.description: Short problem on a visually pleasing boulder. Start right hand on arete near “slide”. Left hand goes real low on lip by ground. Heel hook right. Move along keeping heel until you can get into the dish. Top out at the drill hole. Contrived.    Alternatively start matched on arete and move up until you can top at the drill hole. V0.
content.location: This boulder is is the first little section of the swamp boulders. It’s obviously an old quarry site. Pass the big tree house boulder and look for the boulder with the scoop out of it.

content.description: A slightly overhanging sloper arete. Start from a sit on the far right end and work left. The top out was less than stellar but the arete moves were good.
content.location: Below Novocain/Anthropology right where the swamp necks down to a stream. Only route on the boulder.

content.description: Stand start matched in the large egg shaped dish. Work the sloper arete to the top.
content.location: On the Treehouse boulder just left of Bologna Skins. The egg shaped dish is obvious.

content.description: Sit start the same as for Tales From The Cryptic. Move straight up using a sloper and the large hold out left. You can easily escape left but stay more on a straight line if you want more difficulty.

Start the same as Tree House/Humunga but traverse across the slopey face to the right side arete. You could also start at Feathered and Wedged and traverse the whole boulder. Delicate and friction based. Fun for an easy one.
content.location: On the Treehouse boulder. Traverses the mid section.

content.description: Sit start left corner on a big jug. Move up and right to a nice fin. Top out on the slopers.
content.location: Past all the swamp boulders and almost at the pond is a small smattering of boulders most of which are crap.

content.description: Sit start on a big jug on the left arete. Move up on some good holds heading onto the left face. Mantle top out. Needs a bit more cleaning as things were frozen.
content.location: Way beyond most of the rocks. A cluster of smaller boulders sits behind some houses on route 13 as you get closer to the pond. Remember you’re basically in people’s backyards so use discretion.

content.description: Start on two very small crimps. Find an okay right foot and pull on. Move through a series of crimps and slopers to get to the top. Delicate.
content.location: This is on the first big boulder you see in the swamp area. This first section appears to be an old quarry.  Looks like there was some kids building forts and such in the area. Starts on right side arete.

content.description: Start on two obvious chalked holds and your feet out right. Go up and slightly to the left. Topout
content.protection: pads, its sort of a lowball
content.location: Around the corner to the left of Novocaine. Obvious starter holds chalked up.

content.description: Probably the most striking route at the swamp. It climbs a thin vertical finger tip crack that has a horizontal sloping crack at ten feet. Start on the huge obvious flake and climb directly up pulling the bulge.
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter for the tree.
content.location: At the swamp.

content.description: Sit start matched on the crimp rail at the lip. (might need two pads to reach it if you're shorter) Figure out how to pull on with limited foot options. Top out basically straight up using slopey rail features. As well as a couple good holds in the crack, that are good holds but were hard to use with available foot options. Not sure if this is new or not but was a fun and on nice rock.
content.location: Starts on crimp rail /side pull feature left of the tree that splits "F**k that tree"

content.description: Nice cluster of boulders and small cliff faces situated by a swamp. Gritty granite like the rest of them. Some choss. Shaded by trees in summer and nice filtered sunlight in fall. For the sake of not having a ton of sub areas I’ve lumped a rather large area together for the ease of posting. The first boulder you come across I call the welcome boulder (Raby Soldier/Rock Garden). The next area is what I call the treehouse boulder (Tree House/Bologna Skins/Dishes). Heading out and keeping the stream on your left you’ll come across a collection of smaller boulders and exposed rock face. This is the actual swamp boulders (Novocain/The Fridge/Warped Wall etc). There is more rock out here to be explored, cleaned and climbed. A couple clean v6-v8 (or harder) projects await. Feel free to get on them. Everything here is open. I want things to be sent.  If it isn’t posted it hasn’t been climbed.  Joey Bag O Donuts and Kid Chamelon are tough to find as they’re set back and away from swamp a bit. Explore. There’s lots to see out here.  Potential for ice climbing here too.  I know nothing about that but there’s one cliff face about 35 feet tall at around a 60° angle that ices over thickly in the winter.
